directions: Plant and grow a cacao tree in a suitable climate.
Provide regular sunlight and water for the tree's growth.
After about 3-5 years, the tree will begin producing cacao pods.
Harvest the cacao pods from the tree when they are ripe.
Open the pods and remove the cacao beans from inside.
Ferment the cacao beans for about one week to develop flavor.
Dry the fermented cacao beans in the sun or using a drying machine.
Roast the dried cacao beans to enhance their flavor.
Crack and grind the roasted cacao beans to make cocoa powder.
Use the cocoa powder to make various chocolate-based recipes.
